version_description:
Putty 3D 1.3 is here!

Thanks so much to everyone that sent their feedback, you’ve been instrumental in shaping this update (and future ones, you guys sent lots of feedback :) ).

So what’s new you ask? Here’s some of it:

- Option to export your work to OBJ and STL files, on iPhone 6, iPad Air 2 or newer devices. This is the big one. Now you can export your Putty models to your PC or Mac, to add detail, paint, animate or even 3D print. Go nuts! :)
- New brush shape option, to switch between a round and flat brush (which we like so much that we made it the new default).
- Improved camera and light controls.
- Added options to control the lighting complexity. Use the fast mode for added performance or the 3 point template for fancier lighting before you share your work.
- Ran out of space while sculpting? Now you can resize the sculpting volume to fit more stuff in.
- The pressure curve for the Apple Pencil and 3D Touch was adjusted to make it more comfortable to use. In a future update we plan to add more user control over this.
- Moved the Video Recording over to the main editing screen, making it easier to start and stop recording at any time.
- Lots of tiny fixes and adjustments.

We look forward to hearing what you think of the new features and changes, so please let us know at contact@putty3d.com.
Also, if you’re enjoying Putty 3D, please leave a review on the App Store, it helps us a lot!

- Support for iOS 11 and iPhone X
- Some small bug fixes and usability tweaks
Added support for the new iPad Pro and Apple Pencil
Compatibility update for iOS 13 and iPadOS
